intro: Brachanthemum baranovii, commonly known as the Baranov's bidens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with prominent central disks. Brachanthemum baranovii is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
